bibl.title: Letter from J. F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, November 12, 1947

div1.p: Siler provides Hench with the date of Walter Reed Memorial Association meeting, which has been changed so that Hench may attend.

div1.head: Letter from J. F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, November 12, 1947
div1.opener:
WALTER REED MEMORIAL ASSOCIATION
3434 - 34th Place, N.W.,
Washington 16, D.C.,
November 12, 1947.
Dr. Philip S. Hench
The Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minn
My dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
I beg to advise you that the annual meeting of the Board of
Managers of the Walter Reed Memorial Association will be held in
the Board Room, American Security and Trust Company, Fifteenth
and Pennsylvania Avenue, Northwest, Washington, D.C., at 10:30 A.M.
on November 25, 1947. We trust that you will be able to attend.

So far as can be foreseen, the only matter, other than routine,
to be given consideration will be that of the election of the Sur-
geon General of the Army to permanent membership on the Board for
reasons outlined by General Kean at the last annual meeting. This
will require amendment of the by-laws in such manner as may be
deemed most appropriate by the Board of Managers.
With kindest personal regards, I am

closer.signed:
J. F. Siler
Colonel, U.S.A., Retired
Secretary
closer.seg:
P.S. In addition to the above formal notice of the meeting of the
Board, I would like to say that we are delighted that it will be
possible for you to be present this year. Needless to say, we are
most happy to arrange the time of the meeting to fit in with your
plans. As a matter of fact, I shall be busy on the morning of the
24th as I happen to be president of the Gorgas Memorial Institute
and it holds its annual meeting on Monday the twenty-fourth. We
are looking forward with very great pleasure to seeing you and Mrs.
Hench again.
